thread.title: Facing His Own Nafta Deadline, Speaker Ryan Now Sees Some Wiggle Room

author: William Mauldin
title: Facing His Own Nafta Deadline, Speaker Ryan Now Sees Some Wiggle Room
text:
WASHINGTON—President Donald Trump’s trade chief said Thursday the U.S. is “nowhere near” a deal on the North American Free Trade Agreement, effectively brushing aside an offer from House Speaker Paul Ryan for more time to conclude a deal that could be considered in Congress this year.
“The Nafta countries are nowhere near close to a deal,” U.S. trade representative Robert Lighthizer said in a statement, citing “gaping differences” on intellectual property, agricultural trade, duty-free levels for shipments, labor rules, and...
